channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Biden raises election meddling with Putin in first phone call
item.description: The Russian leader says his first call with the new US president was "business-like and frank".

item.title: Climate change: Biggest global poll supports 'global emergency'
item.description: More than a million people in 50 countries take part in the biggest poll to date on climate change.

item.title: Coronavirus: AstraZeneca defends EU vaccine rollout plan
item.description: The pharmaceutical giant said the late signing of contracts limited time to sort out supply glitches.

item.title: California’s Governor Newsom eases Covid restrictions - why now?
item.description: The governor has lifted the state’s stay-at-home order as test positivity rates have steadily fallen.

item.title: Elliot Page: Juno actor to divorce Emma Portner
item.description: The Oscar-nominated actor and his choreographer wife describe as "difficult" their decision to split.

item.title: Goldman Sachs boss takes $10m pay cut for 1MDB
item.description: David Solomon is being punished for the bank's involvement in the fraudulent Malaysian investment fund.

item.title: Rescued Chinese miners 'feel reborn' after harrowing ordeal
item.description: Two Chinese miners have described how they survived while trapped underground for two weeks.

item.title: India farmer leaders condemn violence but won't call off protests
item.description: The farmers blame Tuesday's violence on rogue protesters and say they will not call off their protest.

item.title: Covid hotspot arrivals face UK hotel quarantine
item.description: The measures will apply to British residents returning to England from areas including southern Africa.

item.title: Biden kicks off inclusive LGBT agenda
item.description: Visitors to the White House website can now choose gender neutral pronouns and titles such as Mx and "they".

item.title: China opens door to Ant Group's stock market debut
item.description: Regulators suspended the tech giant's planned listing before ordering a shake-up at the company.

item.title: Covid: US pharmacist in vaccine tampering guilty plea
item.description: Steven Brandenburg admits he believed inoculation could harm people, prosecutors in Wisconsin say.

item.title: US actress Jane Fonda to get Golden Globes' lifetime achievement award
item.description: The 83-year-old Hollywood royalty is also known as an active climate change campaigner.

item.title: 'It's sad when I sit there alone'
item.description: Already a difficult day, honouring those killed by the Nazis will be different this year, as the pandemic prevents survivors and their families being together.

item.title: How women played a major role in Yemen's Arab Spring
item.description: Yemeni lawyer Ishraq al-Maqtari shares her memories of being one of the first women to take to the streets in Taiz city, which later became known as the 'cradle of the revolution'.

item.title: Iraq killings: Who's behind a series of murders?
item.description: BBC News Arabic investigates a series of killings and the power of Shia militia groups in Iraq.

item.title: Meet the woman behind Bernie Sanders' famous mittens
item.description: Jen Ellis made the mittens Bernie Sanders wore at President Biden's inauguration - now she's receiving thousands of orders.

item.title: What it's like cooped up in 'Hotel Quarantine'
item.description: Travellers share their experiences of isolating in hotels, as UK ministers prepare a similar scheme.

item.title: Tennis star makes chain reaction run in quarantine
item.description: Edouard Roger-Vasselin gets creative while stuck in his hotel ahead of the Australian Open.

item.title: Dozens of smuggled chameleons found in suitcase in Austria
item.description: The animals are being nursed back to health at a zoo after Austrian airport security spotted them.

item.title: Randy Rainbow made his name satirising Trump - now what?
item.description: Why the show's not over for Randy Rainbow who used Broadway tunes to make fun of Donald Trump.

item.title: Keystone XL: Why I fought for - or against - the pipeline
item.description: President Biden has cancelled the permit for the controversial US-Canada project.

item.title: Dave Grohl: 'I dreamt I was shot in the back'
item.description: The Foo Fighters' frontman on the apocalyptic dreams that inspired his band's new album.

item.title: Joe Biden: The team he hopes can fix the US economy
item.description: The new US president has called on a team of Ivy League-trained economists and lawyers to "heal" the economy.

item.title: When your 'pandemic puppy' doesn't work out
item.description: Lockdown seemed like the perfect time to get a dog, but for some, the excitement turned into regret.

item.title: The child environmentalist receiving death threats in Colombia
item.description: Francisco Vera, 11, was threatened after calling for better access to education during the pandemic.

item.title: Mother-and-baby homes: 'They called us fallen women, bad women'
item.description: Adele relives her experience of a mother-and-baby home, as an NI report is published.

item.title: UK Covid deaths: Why the 100,000 toll is so bad
item.description: As the number of people who died reaches six figures, the factors that led to this terrible total.

item.title: West Bromwich Albion 0-5 Manchester City
item.description: Manchester City are the latest side to rout West Brom at The Hawthorns as Pep Guardiola's side go top of the table.

item.title: Thomas Tuchel: Chelsea appoint former PSG manager after sacking Frank Lampard
item.description: Thomas Tuchel is appointed Chelsea's new manager on an 18-month contract after the sacking of Frank Lampard.

item.title: Southampton 1-3 Arsenal: Teenager Bukayo Saka scores one and creates another
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta dedicates his side's Premier League win over Southampton to absent captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.

item.title: West Ham 'have not scratched surface yet' after moving into top four
item.description: West Ham David Moyes feels his side are improving but have "not scratched the surface yet" as they beat Crystal Palace to continue their flawless start to 2021.

item.title: Leeds beat Newcastle to leave Bruce reflecting on 'worst run in 20 years'
item.description: Steve Bruce says he may be on his worst run of results in 20 years as a manager but is encouraged by his Newcastle side's second-half display in the home defeat to Leeds.

item.title: Uncertainty persists over Tokyo 2020 with IOC poised to meet
item.description: The International Olympic Committee meets on Wednesday amid growing uncertainty over this summer's Tokyo Games.

item.title: The homeless drug addict who became a professor
item.description: Jesse Thistle, a high school dropout, overcame addiction and homelessness to pursue an academic career.
